channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How to write an MBA resume that’ll help you get into business school
item.description: MBA resumes are similar to traditional job resumes, with a couple of key differences. Experts detail how to write one, what to avoid—and why.

item.title: Paramount says CEO Bob Bakish is stepping down, will be replaced by a trio of executives
item.description: Paramount Global CEO Bob Bakish is out, the company announced Monday, as merger negotiations with Skydance Media continue.

item.title: Biden backs off long-awaited ban on menthol cigarettes
item.description: “This decision prioritizes politics over lives, especially Black lives,” said Yolonda Richardson of the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, in an emailed statement.

item.title: Get ready, traders: These stocks are expected to have the biggest moves on earnings this week
item.description: Several companies this week are set to report earnings, ranging from chipmakers Super Micro Computer and AMD to health-care giants such as Moderna.

item.title: Business travel survives the Zoom era, as leaders jump back on flights
item.description: Even with Zoom’s implementation, employee travel bounds back to pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Morgan Stanley banker sees 10 to 15 more tech IPOs in 2024, and a 'better year' in 2025
item.description: Morgan Stanley, which led the Reddit and Astera Labs IPOs, expects 10 to 15 more tech offerings this year and a "better year" in 2025.

item.title: Millennials have it better than everyone thinks, accumulating wealth faster than anyone else since the pandemic, new data shows
item.description: “This historic growth is without parallel in recent decades,” according to an analysis from the Center for American Progress.

item.title: Citi says investors should focus on dividends, lists several buy-rated income stocks to buy
item.description: As a lower interest rate environment begins to materialize, investors can turn to dividend-growing stocks for a steady income stream.

item.title: MedMen’s spectacular collapse is complete: Just five years after earning a whopping $3 billion valuation, the one-time legal cannabis darling has declared bankruptcy
item.description: “MedMen has been ‘DeadMen’ to most investors for a long time,” one industry analyst told Fortune.

item.title: Peacock streaming subscription prices to increase by $2 ahead of the Summer Olympics
item.description: Comcast's streaming service Peacock will see a price increase of $2 this summer.
